summary: This bill, the "Renewing Efficiency in Government by Budgeting Act of 2025" (REG Budgeting Act of 2025), mandates the Director of the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) to set annual limits on the total amount of new unfunded regulatory costs imposed by federal agencies. It outlines a process for agencies to propose cost limits, requires congressional approval for limits that increase unfunded costs, and details reporting requirements. The bill establishes an Associate Administrator for Regulatory Budgeting within the OMB and dictates reporting and judicial review processes, all aimed at controlling regulatory costs.
